author: Sam [SNSKY]
title: Corona Immunity Passport
description: While travelling, how can every country trust each others Vaccination certificate (in local language) - an APP or a simple piece of paper.

assessments.note: If correctly implemented this could be a strong candidate. It would obviously take someone with political connection to get it accepted in individual countries, however this could potentially be done by the Cardano team once the PoC is developed. First use could be for smaller countries operating a travel bubble such as Singapore/Hong Kong.
If implemented, this would of course drive user adoption - probably, and unfortunately, with a lot of very reluctant users. However, this proposal addresses the challenge.

Issue of Vaccination passport is a complex process involving the identity of the person and the medical records. Moreover adaption of the proposed blockchain solution by the countries involved is the major problem. The proposal is not comprehensive in its plan to solve these major challenges.

The problem and the solution are within the scope of the challenge, but the absence of metrics and goals makes it difficult to assess the impact of the proposal. In addition, this proposal is a proof of concept, which brings additional risks.

Although the proposal's goal is laudable and would involve recording tamper-proof documentation as transaction metadata, it does not address the critical requirement for a verifiable chain of trust for credentials like a vaccine passport. Without a globally accepted trust framework that verified the metadata before it was placed on the blockchain, the non-tampering verificaiton on on-chain data is moot.
The proposer has stated they are not a Cardano expert. At a minimum they should detail what technical experience they do have which would make the development a prototype likely to be achieved

While Business Development may help in communicating with and between people, the proposer does not indicate technical skills.

A "Charles, please help" is not really a plan.

The proposer is a SPO with marketing experience. The proposal involves solving multifaced app development, government interaction, and medical record collection. There might be a requirement for a team with relevant skill sets to accomplish the task. The task analysis needs to be carried out more thoroughly.

The proposer described experiences in Business Development and Business Strategy, which is subjective. I recommend detailing the qualification further so that we can understand the aptitude to develop the proposal.

As described in the proposal:

"As a technical specification needs to be defined yet, It is tough for me to estimate the fund required but we need to start with a Proof of Concept."

This indicates that there is no defined technical plan and that the defined budget is not feasible.

Verifying a certificate issued on blockchain does not guarantee that there was no fraud, the fraud can occur before the data is included in blockchains and the purpose would be lost, so people could continue to be required to receive vaccines to enter different countries. In addition, there are many different vaccines and countries have different vaccine acceptance standards.

The creation of a covid-19 passport by governments can be a step towards a social credit score system, which is something that really threatens individual freedoms and goes against the ideal of public blockchains. Some jurisdictions, such as Florida, have banned the use of passports, as they are against individual freedoms and could actually be used in a harmful way in authoritarian countries.

The three-phase plan is not described in sufficient detail: in particular, "technical system including front end" needs to be elaborated into a development roadmap. Additionally, the second step of the plan puts Charles Hoskinson on the critical path to success, but the plan doesn't assert that he would assist. "Marketing for rest of world" also needs specifics. Finally, no evidence is provided that the project team has development experience with Cardano development and identity/trust management practices.

There is not enough information on how this would be deployed. Does this require smart phone apps which communicate with the Cardano blockchain? Are these being built as part of the PoC. If so one which smartphone operating system?
While the technological aspect may be feasible enough, this proposal heavily relies on finding agreement with external parties that the proposer has zero access to.

The proposal presents a novel use case for Metadata, however, the technical process for achieving the desired result is not explained. The challenges in the adaptation of this system also need more thorough analysis.

There is no budget breakdown, no metrics, no goals, no KPIs, no roadmap.

I recommend the inclusion of these items and that the proposer follow the documentation to prepare the proposal.

The three-stage plan is too vague to audit in detail for progress and the proposal does not provide a timeline. The final goal is described too abstractly: the proposal would benefit from a more detailed description of how immunization credentials would be validated prior to their inclusion in transaction metadata, since validity is the crux of this proposal's success.

solution: Use Cardano to develop a tamper resistant system, which can be used by the whole world and eases travelling, visiting restaurants etc.
